snippet: Even with the healthiest big economy in Europe, Poland cannot escape the Continent’s economic downturn.
abstract: Poland, long considered healthiest big economy in Europe, has begun to feel pain of Euro crisis, as factories close and overall growth slows; Poland has benefited from retaining its own currency and strong manufacturing sector, but declining demand for exports and government bureaucracy are taking toll.
lead_paragraph: Even with the healthiest big economy in Europe, Poland cannot escape the Continent’s economic downturn.

headline.main: Poland Finds It’s Not Immune to Euro Crisis
headline.print_headline: Poland, Once an Economic Good-News Story, Feels a Big Chill From the Euro Zone
